Desirability.description: An evaluation of how appealing the product concept is to the target audience, considering factors such as user needs, preferences, and market demand.

items.description: A specific aspect of desirability, such as user needs, preferences, or market demand.

Viability.description: An evaluation of the business viability of the product concept, including its potential profitability, market fit, and alignment with organizational goals.

items.description: A specific aspect of viability, such as profitability, market fit, or alignment with goals.

Feasibility.description: An evaluation of the technical and operational feasibility of the product concept, assessing whether it can be realistically developed and implemented.

items.description: A specific aspect of feasibility, such as technical challenges, resource availability, or timeline constraints.

Sustainability.description: An evaluation of the sustainability of the product concept, focusing on its long-term environmental, social, and economic impact.

items.description: A specific aspect of sustainability, such as environmental impact, ethical considerations, or resource efficiency.

IdeaRating.description: A summary score that reflects the overall assessment of the product concept based on the evaluations of desirability, viability, feasibility, and sustainability.
